title: Support for Clear Linux
body:
I had a PR ready to go, but figured There was some discussion to be had. Clear Linux increments their distro's version number with each bundle update. Right now a test image is running version 18240 and will likely be at 18270 by the time you read this. This means that the version detection in: lib/spack/spack/operating_systems/linux_distro.py isn't as useful as it is on a distro with slowly changing version numbers. They do supply an /etc/os-release file, but it trips up Spack as the id returned by distro.linux_distribution contains a string with dashes. There is a VERSION field in the /etc/os-release that doesn't seem to move quite as quickly, leading me to this abomination:

```diff
diff --git a/lib/spack/spack/operating_systems/linux_distro.py b/lib/spack/spack/operating_systems/linux_distro.py
index 7d1e3ca00..1ff309a0f 100644
--- a/lib/spack/spack/operating_systems/linux_distro.py
+++ b/lib/spack/spack/operating_systems/linux_distro.py
@@ -55,4 +55,13 @@ class LinuxDistro(OperatingSystem):
         else:
             version = version[0]
 
+        if 'clear' in distname:        
+            distname = 'clear'         
+            version = '1'
+            with open('/etc/os-release') as os_release:
+                for line in os_release:
+                    if line.startswith('VERSION='):
+                        version=line.lstrip('VERSION=')
+                        version=version.strip()
+
         super(LinuxDistro, self).__init__(distname, version)
```

does anyone have any better suggestions?
